Comment: If you needed to boil it down to core components, I think it’s people that aren’t capable of two things, empathy or developing their own personalities. It’s much easier to fulfill the human need to belong to a tribe by hanging a flag and wearing a hat than it is to be meaningfully introspective - which is also how you’d develop empathy.   I think there are a number of contributing factors that lead to someone being in this position. Some of it is just that a certain percentage of humans are going to be wired this way. Some of it is growing up in very homogenized communities with low-key authoritarian leaders at church, school, jobs, etc. And some of it is the fact that they feel angry about working hard but it never seeming to pan out the way they thought it would, or were told it would.   But without introspection, they cannot and will not question what they’re told by their tribe. And that need to belong is so strong, they can’t risk losing that status.
Author: johhnny5
